channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023081056
item.description:
Report X-2023081056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS DIRECTED TO DOOR IN THE UNLOAD TO CLEAN UP A SPILL FROM A LEAKING PACKAGE. DR PROCEEDED TO DISPOSE OF THE HAZMAT PACKAGE THROUGH THR DAMAGED MATERIAL PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023080897
item.description:
Report X-2023080897

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME TO QA WET. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION FOUND THAT TWO OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSEING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK INTO THE BOX. ALL EXCESS LIQUID ABSORBED BY THE BOX. BOX DRUMMED AND SENT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA

item.title: Report X-2023080382
item.description:
Report X-2023080382

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTFIED BY IRREG TRAIN DRIVER THAT A DECLARED HAZAMAT LOADED ON THE TRAIN HAD A STAIN ON IT. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN FROM THE TRAIN TO THE PSC. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE STAIN WAS CAUSED BY THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023080838
item.description:
Report E-2023080838

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one case of weld on (un1133) had been damaged in transit by the load shifting and that 3 of the inner metal one gallon can had released 6 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
